page.title: 19Barkestone landscape
page.content: The local landscape is quite hilly.There are woods nearby which belong to the Duke or Rutland.The three villages of Redmile Plungar and Barkestone all have farms so there are a lot of fields which grow crops or are for grazing.The ground is quite high and from Barkestone near the church you can see Newark on a clear day.Light aircraft fron nearby Langar can often be seen as people like to parachute from them.The canal runs through all three villages and is quite clean.A railway used to run through the villages too but the track has been taken up since it is no longer used.People like to come from the towns to stay or visit our villages as they are very attractive.The villages are small and the roads are also narrow.
